clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Mixture of Probiotics on the Antigen Specific Antibody Response in a Influenza Vaccination Model of Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Mixture of Probiotics ( Lactobacillus Gasseri PA16/8,Bifidobacterium Longum SP07/3, Bifidobacterium Bifidum MF 20/5) on the Antigen Specific Antibody Response in a Influenza Vaccination Model of Healthy Adult

brief_summary.textblock: the aim of the study is to get evidence for an enhancement of immune status in subjects after probiotics mixture consumption ( lactobacillus gasseri PA 16/8, Bifidobacterrium longum SP 07/3, Bifidobacterium bifidum MF 20/5) based on influenza vaccination model - compared to placebo.

detailed_description.textblock:
probiotics are "live microorganisms which when administered in adequate amounts confer a health benefit on the host" . many health effects are associated with probiotics , but various degrees of evidence support the benefits associated to probiotics consumption . Impact on defences and the immune system has been shown with several strains and this may result in improved protection against some infections or improvment of vaccine efficacy .
In its scientific requirments for health claims related to immune function, EFSA indicates that it is generally accepted that higher vaccination responses are beneficial.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: geographic mean of the increase of antibody titreq against at least one flu strain among the 3 forming the flu vaccine ( H1N1, H3, N and B ) within 3 weeks after flu vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: seroprotection of the population of volunteers geometric mean of the increase of antibody titres seroprotection in the subset population non sero-protected at V1

clinical_study.condition: Enhancement of Protective Antibody Response After Probiotic Consumption
